This is the era of Internet. Everything you post online will no longer be """"privately"""" yours anymore, that's the harsh truth. The other day, I read news about Taiwanese woman who claimed her life and career are ruined from one picture that is circulated as a meme. I bet more will come forward to claim that their lives have been negatively affected by the multiplication of digital content that has them in it.

I can't believe the animosity toward these guys. If it BLM, they would have burned Burns down. They had a grievance against the Federal gov't & no one would listen. Have any of u even looked into why Cliven wouldn't pay his grazing fees? There's more that meets the eye to this story & most of u won't put the time into digging the story out, not even the Oregonian.Youre too busy hating.

We had every console going. My father was just as interested in this new technology as we were. I'm artistic - was well able to entertain myself as a child - & had to be dragged in from climbing trees, when it was raining. I wouldn't say I turned out fantastic, but I'm alright. Was the same fear mongering not there when the T.V. first came along? Besides, kids have to be tech savvy these days, otherwise they will get left behind in the future & have less opportunities available to them. Learning to code is akin to learning a language.
I hope they let Siri drive I'll take one. Will it be called an iCar?
